column4: Right.  So I use virtualbox, and I would like to back up my Windows virtual machine but it will take at least 2 dvd's to backup, any suggestions?
None, is there a program to break files into parts?
I have a lot of blank dvds
I was thinking maybe RAR or some command line utility could do that
split is a simple terminal based utility for splitting files.

They both use the same installer, and can both install either desktop or server. The difference is that the "Alternate" install CD contains all of the packages needed for ubuntu-desktop on the CD so you don't need to download them during install, and the "Server" install CD contains all the pacakges needed for ubuntu-server.
It's very unlikely that 9.10 will get a newer major version of the kernel.
It's not a speedup patch, it's a responsiveness path that helps in very specific curcomstances
well it would certainly help me, so is it going to be in the next kernel? or am I going to have to upgrade to 11.04?
I belive this will work with 9.10, though I haven't tested it myself: http://blog.glock.co.za/cgroup-user-space-speed-patch
will it be in the latest version of Ubuntu?
1 GiB should be more than enough.
you know the USB Startup Disk Creator in System>Administration
Yes.
It may not have had enough free space. Did you have any files on the flash drive already?
Worth a try, yes.
It's also small enough that all of the changes can be cached in RAM, then written out to disk while you're doing other things.
sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /media/external/

Because of the aformentioned delayed write you don't want to unplug the flash drive right after writing to it (even with gparted) without "ejecting" it (which does more than just unmounting does) or at least running "sync".

I think you're going to have problems if you try to make a bootable 10.10 USB with unetbootin or USB creator from 9.10. (though those problems would be completely unrelated to your current problem though).
Did you unplug the thumb drive without ejecting it or running "sync"?
